member.name: M:Dynamsoft.Common.Util.Clone(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Clone image.
member.param: Source image.
member.returns: Return clone of the source image.
member.remarks: The original Bitmap.Clone() does not produce the desired result - it does not create an actual clone (it does not create a copy of the image). That is why this method was implemented to provide the functionality.

member.summary: Clone image.

member.returns: Clones image from source image data. The message does not clone pallete in the case if the source image has indexed pixel format.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.Common.Util.CopyUnmanagedMemory(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copy block of unmanaged memory.
member.param: Destination pointer.
Source pointer.
Memory block's length to copy.
member.returns: Return's value of - pointer to destination.

remarks.para: This function is required because of the fact that .NET does not provide any way to copy unmanaged blocks, but provides only methods to copy from unmanaged memory to managed memory and vise versa.

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager
member.summary: A class that provides functionality to get image data from all TWAIN compatible devices.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.AcquireImage(Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Interface.IAcquireCallback)
member.summary: Displays the source's built-in interface to acquire image.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: This method does the same thing as EnableSource(). This method is used to help users to handle Twain-compliant image acquisition devices without knowing the terms used in Twain specification.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.CapGet
member.summary: Gets the information of the capability specified by the Capability property.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: Please set Capability property before invoking CapGet(). If only one type for the returned value of this capability is supported, there is no need to set CapType property since it will be returned from the source when CapGet() is called.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.CapGetCurrent
member.summary: Returns the current value of the specified capability for the source.

member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: Please set Capability property before invoking CapGetCurrent(). After calling CapGetCurrent(), please check CapType property for the type this capability supports. This process is similar to CapGet(), please refer to CapType property.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.CapGetDefault
member.summary: Returns the default value for the specified capability of the source.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: Please set Capability property before invoking CapGetDefault().

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.CapIfSupported(Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWQC)
member.summary: Checks if the source supports a particular operation of the capability.
member.param: TWQC type: specifies the type of capability operation. Value Description TWQC_GET (1): If CapGet() is supported by the capability. TWQC_SET (2): If CapSet() is supported by the capability. TWQC_GETDEFAULT (4): If CapGetDefault() is supported by the capability. TWQC_GETCURRENT (8): If CapGetCurrent() is supported by the capability. TWQC_RESET (16): If CapReset() is supported by the capability.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occur, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: Please set Capability property before calling CapIfSupported().

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.OpenSourceManager
member.summary: Loads and opens Data Source Manager.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: If application identification information needs to be set, it should be set before OpenSourceManager(). Dynamic .NET TWAIN has a built-in Wizard Mode. With Wizard Mode, OpenSourceManager() is called automatically when needed by methods like EnableSource() or SelectSource(). OpenSourceManager() populates Source NameItems property with a list of installed sources. SourceNameItems property along with other properties and methods can be used to customize source selection interface.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.SetFileXFERInfo(System.String,Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWICapFileFormat)
member.summary: Sets the absolute file name (including its path) and file format used in File Transfer Mode
member.param: The name of the file to be used in transfer.e.g."C:\\webtwain.jpg"

TWICapFileFormat type: a enumerated values indicates the format of the image. The followings are the allowed formats: TWFF_TIFF(0), TWFF_PICT(1), TWFF_BMP(2), TWFF_XBM(3), TWFF_JFIF(4), TWFF_FPX(5), TWFF_TIFFMULTI(6), TWFF_PNG(7), TWFF_SPIFF(8), TWFF_EXIF( 9)
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: The SetFileXFERInfo() is valid only in File Transfer Mode. Before using any file format, please set ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT capability to make sure if the source support the image format. In File Transfer Mode, the image is transferred to the designated location on the disk directly instead of Dynamic .NET TWAIN.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.GetCapItems(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an array of values of the capability specified by Capability property, when the value of the CapType property is TWON_ARRAY or TWON_ENUMERATION. This is a runtime property.
member.param: The index is 0-based.
member.returns: Capability property value.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: Please check this property after calling CapGet() method. This property has a parameter. The data type of the parameter is int and it is 0-based. The GetCapItems is used to return the result in Double, Single(Float), Long, Integer and Boolean types. To return String type, please use GetCapItemsString. When using Double type for Boolean type, 1 indicates true, 0 indicates false. The constant true/false of Visual Basic can NOT be used. This property is similar to CapValue property and CapValueString property. CapValueString property is used to present String type while CapValue is used to present other types. CapValue property and CapValueString property are used when the container type is TWON_ONEVALUE.

member.name: M:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.SetCapItems(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets an array of values of the capability specified by Capability property, when the value of the CapType property is TWON_ARRAY or TWON_ENUMERATION. This is a runtime property.
member.param: The index is 0-based.
Capability property value.
member.returns: True indicates success. False indicates failure.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: After setting this property, call CapSet() method to set the value. The SetCapItems property is used to return the results of Double, Single(Float), Long, Integer and Boolean types. To return String type, please use SetCapItemsString. When using Double type for Boolean type, 1 indicates true, 0 indicates false. The constant true/false of Visual Basic can NOT be used. This property is similar to CapValue property and CapValueString property. CapValueString property is used to present String type while CapValue is used to present other types. CapValue property and CapValueString property are used when the container type is TWON_ONEVALUE.

member.summary: Returns or sets the step size in a range when the value of the CapType property is TWON_RANGE. This is a runtime property.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.CapType
member.summary: Returns or sets the type of capability container used to exchange capability information between application and source. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks:
Allowed Values Description
TWON_ARRAY(3)
An array of associated individual values. CapNumItems property, GetCapItems/SetCapItems/GetCapItemsString/SetCapItemsString methods are valid.
TWON_ENUMERATION(4) A group of associated individual values. The values are ordered from the lowest to highest, but the step size between every two values might not be the same. CapNumItems property, CapCurrentIndex property, CapDefaultIndex property, GetCapItems/SetCapItems/GetCapItemsString/SetCapItemsString methods are valid.
TWON_ONEVALUE(5) A single value. CapValue property and CapValueString property are valid.
TWON_RANGE(6) A range of individual values. CapMinValue property, CapMaxValue property, CapStepSize property, CapDefaultValue property and CapCurrentValue property are valid.
Please set CapType when setting a capability with CapSet. Please check CapType after reading a capability by CapGet. CapDefaultIndex property and CapDefaultValue property reflect power-on values and are not available with CapSet().

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.CapValueType
member.summary: Returns or sets the value type for reading the value of a capability. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: Please check this property after calling CapGet() method. After setting this property, please call CapSet() method to set the value.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.CapValue
member.summary: Returns or sets the value of the capability specified by Capability property when the value of the CapType property is TWON_ONEVALUE. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: Please check this property after calling CapGet() method. After setting this property, please call CapSet() method to set the value. The Double type of CapValue property is used to present Double, Single(Float), Long, Integer and Boolean types. For String type, please use CapValueString property. When using Double type for Boolean type, 1 indicates true, 0 indicates false. The constant true/false of Visual Basic can NOT be used. This property is similar to GetCapItems and GetCapItemsString. GetCapItemsString is used to present String type while GetCapItems is used to present other types. GetCapItems and GetCapItemsString are used when the container type is TWON_ARRAY or TWON_ENUMERATION.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.CapValueString
member.summary: Returns or sets the string value for a capability when the value of the CapType property is TWON_ONEVALUE. This is a runtime property.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: Please check this property after calling CapGet() method. After setting this property, please call CapSet() method to set the value. CapValueString property is used to set or return String type value. For any other data types when the CapType property is TWON_ONEVALUE, please use CapValue property.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.IfDisableSourceAfterAcquire
member.summary: Returns or sets whether to close the User Interface after all images have been scanned and transferred. The default value of this property is false.
member.exception: When an error occurs, please check TwainException.
member.remarks: IfShowUI IfDisableSourceAfterAcquire Actions true false UI will be shown, one or many images will be acquired(if supported by the DataSource), UI will not be closed automatically and needs to be closed manually. true true UI will be shown, one or many images will be acquired(if supported by the DataSource), UI will be closed automatically. false false UI will not be shown, one or many images will be acquired(if supported by the DataSource), UI will not be closed automatically and needs to be closed manually. false true UI will not be shown, one or many images will be acquired(if supported by the DataSource), UI will be closed automatically.

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.IfFeederEnabled

member.name: P:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.TwainManager.ImageLayoutFrameNumber
member.summary: Returns the frame number of the current image. This is a runtime, read-only property.

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType
member.summary: Capabilities exist in many varieties but all of them have a Default Value and a Current Value and may also have other values available. To help categorize the supported values into clear structures, TWAIN defines four types of containers for capabilities: TW_ONEVALUE, TW_ARRAY, TW_RANGE and TW_ENUMERATION.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType.TWON_NONE
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType.TWON_ARRAY
member.summary: A rectangular array of values that describe a logical item. It is similar to the TW_ONEVALUE because the current and default values are the same and there are no other values to select from. For example, a list of the names, such as the supported capabilities list returned by the CAP_SUPPORTEDCAPS capability, would use this type of container.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType.TWON_ENUMERATION
member.summary: This is the most general type because it defines a list of values from which the Current Value can be chosen. The values do not increase uniformly through a range and there is no constant step-size between 2 values. For example, if the step size of a Source's resolution is not the same, then the enumeration can be used (for example, 150, 400, and 600).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType.TWON_ONEVALUE
member.summary: A single value whose current and default values are coincident. The range of available values for this type of capability is simply this single value. For example, a capability that indicates the presence of a document feeder could be of this type.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapType.TWON_RANGE
member.summary: Many capabilities allow users to select their current value from a range of regularly spaced values. The capability can specify the minimum and maximum acceptable values and the incremental step size between the values. For example, resolution might be supported from 100 to 600 in steps of 50 (100, 150, 200, ..., 550, 600).

member.name: T:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability
member.summary: Capabilities.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_NONE
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_XFERCOUNT
member.summary: The application is willing to accept this number of images.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_COMPRESSION
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which compression schemes they have in common for Buffered Memory and File transfers. Note for File transfers: Since only certain file formats support compression, this capability must be negotiated after setting the desired file format with ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PIXELTYPE
member.summary: The type of pixel data that a Source is capable of acquiring (for example, black and white, gray, RGB, etc.).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_UNITS
member.summary: Unless a quantity is dimensionless or uses a specified unit of measure, ICAP_UNITS determines the unit of measure for all quantities.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_XFERMECH
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which transfer mechanisms the source supports.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_AUTHOR
member.summary: The name or other identifying information about the Author of the image. It may include a copyright string.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_CAPTION
member.summary: A general note about the acquired image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_FEEDERENABLED
member.summary: If TRUE, Source must acquire data from the document feeder acquire area and other feeder capabilities can be used. If FALSE, Source must acquire data from the non-feeder acquire area and no other feeder capabilities can be used.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_FEEDERLOADED
member.summary: Reflects whether there are documents loaded in the Sources feeder.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_TIMEDATE
member.summary:
The date and time the image was acquired.
Stored in the form YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:SS.sss where YYYY is the year, MM is the numerical month, DD is the numerical day, HH is the hour, mm is the minute, SS is the second, and sss is the millisecond.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_SUPPORTEDCAPS
member.summary: Returns a list of all the capabilities for which the Source will answer inquiries. Does not indicate which capabilities the Source will allow to be set by the application. Some capabilities can only be set if certain setup work has been done so the Source cannot globally answer which capabilities are set-able.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_EXTENDEDCAPS
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to negotiate capabilities to be used in States 5 and 6.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_AUTOFEED
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will automatically feed the next page from the document feeder after the number of frames negotiated for capture from each page are acquired. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must be TRUE to use this capability.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_CLEARPAGE
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will eject the current page being acquired from and will leave the feeder acquire area empty. If CAP_AUTOFEED is TRUE, a fresh page will be advanced. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must equal TRUE to use this capability. This capability must have been negotiated as an extended capability to be used in States 5 and 6.

members.member:
If TRUE, the Source will eject the current page and advance the next page in the document feeder into the feeder acquire area. If CAP_AUTOFEED is TRUE, the same action just described will occur and CAP_AUTOFEED will remain active. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must equal TRUE to use this capability. This capability must have been negotiated as an extended capability to be used in States 5 and 6.
20170104

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_REWINDPAGE
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will return the current page to the input side of the document feeder and feed the last page from the output side of the feeder back into the acquisition area. If CAP_AUTOFEED is TRUE, automatic feeding will continue after all negotiated frames from this page are acquired. CAP_FEEDERENABLED must equal TRUE to use this capability. This capability must have been negotiated as an extended capability to be used in States 5 and 6.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_INDICATORS
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will display a progress indicator during acquisition and transfer, regardless of whether the Sources user interface is active. If FALSE, the progress indicator will be suppressed if the Sources user interface is inactive. The Source will continue to display device-specific instructions and error messages even with the Source user interface and progress indicators turned off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_SUPPORTEDCAPSEXT
member.summary: Returns a list of all the capabilities for which the Source will answer inquiries. Does not indicate which capabilities the Source will allow to be set by the application. Some capabilities can only be set if certain setup work has been done so the Source cannot globally answer which capabilities are set-able.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PAPERDETECTABLE
member.summary: This capability determines whether the device has a paper sensor that can detect documents on the ADF or Flatbed.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_UICONTROLLABLE
member.summary: If TRUE, indicates that this Source supports acquisition with the UI disabled; i.e., TW_USERINTERFACEs ShowUI field can be set to FALSE. If FALSE, indicates that this Source can only support acquisition with the UI enabled.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_DEVICEONLINE
member.summary: If TRUE, the physical hardware (e.g., scanner, digital camera, image database, etc.) that represents the image source is attached, powered on, and communicating.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_AUTOSCAN
member.summary: This capability is intended to boost the performance of a Source. The fundamental assumption behind AutoScan is that the device is able to capture the number of images indicated by the value of CAP_XFERCOUNT without waiting for the Application to request the image transfers. This is only possible if the device has internal buffers capable of caching the images it captures. The default behavior is undefined, because some high volume devices are incapable of anything but CAP_AUTOSCAN being equal to TRUE. However, if a Source supports FALSE, it should use it as the mandatory default, since this best describes the behavior of pre-1.8 TWAIN Applications.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_THUMBNAILSENABLED
member.summary: Allows an application to request the delivery of thumbnail representations for the set of images that are to be delivered. Setting CAP_THUMBNAILSENABLED to TRUE turns on thumbnail mode. Images transferred thereafter will be sent at thumbnail size (exact thumbnail size is determined by the Data Source). Setting this capability to FALSE turns thumbnail mode off and returns full size images.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_DUPLEX
member.summary: This indicates whether the scanner supports duplex. If so, it further indicates whether one-path or two-path duplex is supported.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_DUPLEXENABLED
member.summary: The user can set the duplex option to be TRUE or FALSE. If TRUE, the scanner scans both sides of a paper; otherwise, the scanner will scan only one side of the image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_ENABLEDSUIONLY
member.summary: Allows an application to query a source to see if it implements the new user interface settings dialog.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_ENDORSER
member.summary: Allows the application to specify the starting endorser / imprinter number. All other endorser/ imprinter properties should be handled through the data sources user interface. The user can set the starting number for the endorser.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_ALARMS
member.summary: Turns specific audible alarms on and off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_ALARMVOLUME
member.summary: The volume of a devices audible alarm. Note that this control affects the volume of all alarms; no specific volume control for individual types of alarms is provided.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_AUTOMATICCAPTURE
member.summary: The number of images to automatically capture. This does not refer to the number of images to be sent to the Application, use CAP_XFERCOUNT for that.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_TIMEBEFOREFIRSTCAPTURE
member.summary: For automatic capture, this value selects the number of milliseconds before the first picture is to be taken, or the first image is to be scanned.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_TIMEBETWEENCAPTURES
member.summary: For automatic capture, this value selects the milliseconds to wait between pictures taken, or images scanned.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_CLEARBUFFERS
member.summary: CapGet() reports the presence of data in the scanner's buffers. CapSet() with a value of TWCB_CLEAR immediately clears the buffers.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_MAXBATCHBUFFERS
member.summary: Describes the number of pages that the scanner can buffer when CAP_AUTOSCAN is enabled.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_DEVICETIMEDATE
member.summary: The date and time of the devices clock. Managed in the form YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:SS:sss where YYYY is the year, MM is the numerical month, DD is the numerical day, HH is the hour, mm is the minute, SS is the second, and sss is the millisecond.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_POWERSUPPLY
member.summary: CapGet() reports the kinds of power available to the device. CapGetCurrent() reports the current power supply in use.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_CAMERAPREVIEWUI
member.summary: This capability queries the Source for UI support for preview mode. If TRUE, the Source supports preview UI.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_SERIALNUMBER
member.summary: A string containing the serial number of the currently selected device in the Source. Multiple devices may all report the same serial number.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTER
member.summary: CapGet() returns the current list of available printer devices, along with the one currently being used for negotiation. CapSet() selects the current device for negotiation, and optionally constrains the list. Top/Bottom refers to duplex devices, and indicates if the printer is writing on the top or the bottom of the sheet of paper. Simplex devices use the top settings. Before/After indicates whether printing occurs before or after the sheet of paper has been scanned.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTERENABLED
member.summary: Turns the current CAP_PRINTER device on or off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTERINDEX
member.summary: The User can set the starting number for the current CAP_PRINTER device.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTERMODE
member.summary: Specifies the appropriate current CAP_PRINTER device mode. Note: TWPM_SINGLESTRING specifies that the printed text will consist of a single string. TWPM _MULTISTRING specifies that the printed text will consist of an enumerated list of strings to be printed in order. TWPM _COMPOUNDSTRING specifies that the printed string will consist of a compound of a String followed by a value followed by a suffix string.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTERSTRING
member.summary: Specifies the string(s) that are to be used in the string component when the current CAP_PRINTER device is enabled.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_PRINTERSUFFIX
member.summary: Specifies the string that shall be used as the current CAP_PRINTER devices suffix.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_LANGUAGE
member.summary: Allows Application and Source to identify which languages they have in common for the exchange of string data, and to select the language of the internal UI. Since the TWLG_xxxx codes include language and country data, there is no separate capability for selecting the country.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_FEEDERALIGNMENT
member.summary: Helps the Application determine any special actions it may need to take when negotiating frames with the Source. Allowed values are listed in . TWFA_NONE: The alignment is free-floating. Applications should assume that the origin for frames is on the left. TWFA_LEFT: The alignment is to the left. TWFA_CENTER: The alignment is centered. This means that the paper will be fed in the middle of the ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH of the device. If this is set, then the Application should calculate any frames with a left offset of zero. TWFA_RIGHT: The alignment is to the right.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_FEEDERORDER
member.summary: TWFO_FIRSTPAGEFIRST if the feeder starts with the top of the first page. TWFO_LASTPAGEFIRST is the feeder starts with the top of the last page.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_REACQUIREALLOWED
member.summary: Indicates whether the physical hardware (e.g. scanner, digital camera) is capable of acquiring multiple images of the same page without changes to the physical registration of that page.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_BATTERYMINUTES
member.summary: The minutes of battery power remaining to the device.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.CAP_BATTERYPERCENTAGE
member.summary: When used with CapGet(), return the percentage of battery power level on camera. If -1 is returned, it indicates that the battery is not present.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTOBRIGHT
member.summary: TRUE enables and FALSE disables the Sources Auto-brightness function (if any).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BRIGHTNESS
member.summary: The brightness values available within the Source.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_CONTRAST
member.summary: The contrast values available within the Source.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_CUSTHALFTONE
member.summary: Specifies the square-cell halftone (dithering) matrix the Source should use to halftone the image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_EXPOSURETIME
member.summary: Specifies the exposure time used to capture the image, in seconds.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_FILTER
member.summary: Describes the color characteristic of the subtractive filter applied to the image data. Multiple filters may be applied to a single acquisition.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_FLASHUSED
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the image was acquired using a flash.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_GAMMA
member.summary: Gamma correction value for the image data.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_HALFTONES
member.summary: A list of names of the halftone patterns available within the Source.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_HIGHLIGHT
member.summary: Specifies which value in an image should be interpreted as the lightest highlight. All values lighter than this value will be clipped to this value. Whether lighter values are smaller or larger can be determined by examining the Current value of ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT
member.summary: Informs the application which file formats the Source can generate (CapGet()). Tells the Source which file formats the application can handle (CapSet()). TWFF_TIFF Used for document TWFF_PICT Native Macintosh TWFF_BMP Native Microsoft TWFF_XBM Used for document TWFF_JFIF Wrapper for JPEG TWFF_FPX FlashPix, used with digital TWFF_TIFFMULTI Multi-page TIFF files TWFF_PNG An image format standard intended for use on the web, replaces GIF TWFF_SPIFF A standard from JPEG, intended to replace JFIF, also supports JBIG TWFF_EXIF File format for use with digital cameras.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_LAMPSTATE
member.summary: TRUE means the lamp is currently, or should be set to ON. Sources may not support CapSet() operations.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_LIGHTSOURCE
member.summary: Describes the general color characteristic of the light source used to acquire the image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_ORIENTATION
member.summary: Defines which edge of the "paper" the image's "top" is aligned with. This information is used to adjust the frames to match the scanning orientation of the paper. For instance, if an ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZE of TWSS_ISOA4 has been negotiated, and ICAP_ORIENTATION is set to TWOR_LANDSCAPE, then the Source must rotate the frame it downloads to the scanner to reflect the orientation of the paper. Please note that setting ICAP_ORIENTATION does not affect the values reported by ICAP_FRAMES; it just causes the Source to use them in a different way. The upper-left of the image is defined as the location where both the primary and secondary scans originate. (The X axis is the primary scan direction and the Y axis is the secondary scan direction.) For a flatbed scanner, the light bar moves in the secondary scan direction. For a handheld scanner, the scanner is drug in the secondary scan direction. For a digital camera, the secondary direction is the vertical axis when the viewed image is considered upright.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH
member.summary: The maximum physical width (X-axis) the Source can acquire (measured in units of ICAP_UNITS).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PHYSICALHEIGHT
member.summary: The maximum physical height (Y-axis) the Source can acquire (measured in units of ICAP_UNITS).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_SHADOW
member.summary: Specifies which value in an image should be interpreted as the darkest shadow. All values darker than this value will be clipped to this value.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_FRAMES
member.summary: The list of frames the Source will acquire on each page.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_XNATIVERESOLUTION
member.summary: The native optical resolution along the X-axis of the device being controlled by the Source. Most devices will respond with a single value (TW_ONEVALUE). This is NOT a list of all resolutions that can be generated by the device. Rather, this is the resolution of the devices optics. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_YNATIVERESOLUTION
member.summary: The native optical resolution along the Y-axis of the device being controlled by the Source. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_XRESOLUTION
member.summary: All the X-axis resolutions the Source can provide. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data). That is, when the units are TWUN_PIXELS, both ICAP_XRESOLUTION and ICAP_YRESOLUTION shall report 1 pixel/pixel. Some data sources like to report the actual number of pixels that the device reports, but that response is more appropriate in ICAP_PHYSICALHEIGHT and ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_YRESOLUTION
member.summary: All the Y-axis resolutions the Source can provide. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data). That is, when the units are TWUN_PIXELS, both ICAP_XRESOLUTION and ICAP_YRESOLUTION shall report 1 pixel/pixel. Some data sources like to report the actual number of pixels that the device reports, but that response is more appropriate in ICAP_PHYSICALHEIGHT and ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_MAXFRAMES
member.summary: The maximum number of frames the Source can provide or the application can accept per page. This is a bounding capability only. It does not establish current or future behavior.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_TILES
member.summary: This is used with buffered memory transfers. If TRUE, Source can provide application with tiled image data.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BITORDER
member.summary: Specifies how the bytes in an image are filled by the Source. TWBO_MSBFIRST indicates that the leftmost bit in the byte (usually bit 7) is the byte's Most Significant Bit.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_CCITTKFACTOR
member.summary: Used for CCITT Group 3 2-dimensional compression. The K factor indicates how often the new compression baseline should be re-established. A value of 2 or 4 is common in facsimile communication. A value of zero in this field will indicate an infinite K factorthe baseline is only calculated at the beginning of the transfer.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_LIGHTPATH
member.summary: Describes whether the image was captured transmissively or reflectively.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR
member.summary: Sense of the pixel whose numeric value is zero (minimum data value).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PLANARCHUNKY
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which color data formats are available. There are two options, planar and chunky.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_ROTATION
member.summary: How the Source can/should rotate the scanned image data prior to transfer. This doesnt use ICAP_UNITS. It is always measured in degrees. Any applied value is additive with any rotation specified in ICAP_ORIENTATION.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZES
member.summary: For devices that support fixed frame sizes. Defined sizes match typical page sizes. This specifies the size(s) the Source can/should use to acquire image data.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_THRESHOLD
member.summary: Specifies the dividing line between black and white. This is the value the Source will use to threshold, if needed, when ICAP_PIXELTYPE = TWPT_BW. The value is normalized so there are no units of measure associated with this ICAP.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_XSCALING
member.summary: All the X-axis scaling values available. A value of 1.0 is equivalent to 100% scaling. Do not use values less than or equal to zero.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_YSCALING
member.summary: All the Y-axis scaling values available. A value of 1.0 is equivalent to 100% scaling. Do not use values less than or equal to zero. There are no units inherent with this data as it is normalized to 1.0 being unscaled.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BITORDERCODES
member.summary: Used for CCITT data compression only. Indicates the bit order representation of the stored compressed codes.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PIXELFLAVORCODES
member.summary: Used only for CCITT data compression. Specifies whether the compressed codes pixel sense will be inverted from the Current value of ICAP_PIXELFLAVOR prior to transfer.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_JPEGPIXELTYPE
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to agree upon a common set of color descriptors that are made available by the Source. This ICAP is only useful for JPEG-compressed buffered memory image transfers.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_TIMEFILL
member.summary: Used only with CCITT data compression. Specifies the minimum number of words of compressed codes (compressed data) to be transmitted per line.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BITDEPTH
member.summary: Specifies the pixel bit depths for the Current value of ICAP_PIXELTYPE. For example, when using ICAP_PIXELTYPE = TWPT_GRAY, this capability specifies whether this is 8-bit gray or 4-bit gray. This depth applies to all the data channels (for instance, the R, G, and B channels will all have this same bit depth for RGB data).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BITDEPTHREDUCTION
member.summary: Specifies the Reduction Method the Source should use to reduce the bit depth of the data. Most commonly used with ICAP_PIXELTYPE = TWPT_BW to reduce gray data to black and white.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_UNDEFINEDIMAGESIZE
member.summary: If TRUE the Source will issue a MSG_XFERREADY before starting the scan. Note: The Source may need to scan the image before initiating the transfer. This is the case if the scanned image is rotated or merged with another scanned image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_EXTIMAGEINFO
member.summary: Allows the application to query the data source to see if it supports extended image attribute capabilities, such as Barcode Recognition, Shaded Area Detection and Removal, Skew detection and Removal, and so on.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_MINIMUMHEIGHT
member.summary: Allows the source to define the minimum height (Y-axis) that the source can acquire.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_MINIMUMWIDTH
member.summary: Allows the source to define theminimum width (X-axis) that the source can acquire.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTODISCARDBLANKPAGES
member.summary: Use this capability to have the Source discard blank images. The Application never sees these images during the scanning session. TWBP_DISABLE this must be the default state for the Source. It indicates that all images will be delivered to the Application, none of them will be discarded. TWBP_AUTO if this is used, then the Source will decide if an image is blank or not and discard as appropriate. If the specified value is a positive number in the range 0 to 2311, then this capability will use it as the byte size cutoff point to identify which images are to be discarded. If the size of the image is less than or equal to this value, then it will be discarded. If the size of the image is greater than this value, then it will be kept so that it can be transferred to the Application.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_FLIPROTATION
member.summary: Flip rotation is used to properly orient images that flip orientation every other image. TWFR_BOOK The images to be scanned are viewed in book form, flipping each page from left to right or right to left. TWFR_FANFOLD The images to be scanned are viewed in fanfold paper style, flipping each page up or down.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BARCODEDETECTIONENABLED
member.summary: Turns bar code detection on and off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_SUPPORTEDBARCODETYPES
member.summary: Provides a list of bar code types that can be detected by the current Data Source.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BARCODEMAXSEARCHPRIORITIES
member.summary: The maximum number of supported search priorities.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BARCODESEARCHPRIORITIES
member.summary: A prioritized list of bar code types dictating the order in which bar codes will be sought.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BARCODESEARCHMODE
member.summary: Restricts bar code searching to certain orientations, or prioritizes one orientation over the other.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BARCODEMAXRETRIES
member.summary: Restricts the number of times a search will be retried if none are found on each page.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_BARCODETIMEOUT
member.summary: Restricts the total time spent on searching for a bar code on each page.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_ZOOMFACTOR
member.summary: When used with CapGet(), returns all camera supported lens zooming range.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PATCHCODEDETECTIONENABLED
member.summary: Turns patch code detection on and off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_SUPPORTEDPATCHCODETYPES
member.summary: A list of patch code types that may be detected by the current Data Source.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PATCHCODEMAXSEARCHPRIORITIES
member.summary: The maximum number of supported search priorities.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PATCHCODESEARCHPRIORITIES
member.summary: A prioritized list of patch code types dictating the order in which patch codes will be sought.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PATCHCODESEARCHMODE
member.summary: Restricts patch code searching to certain orientations, or prioritizes one orientation over the other.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PATCHCODEMAXRETRIES
member.summary: Restricts the number of times a search will be retried if none are found on each page.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_PATCHCODETIMEOUT
member.summary: Restricts the total time spent on searching for a patch code on each page.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_FLASHUSED2
member.summary: For devices that support flash. CapSet() selects the flash to be used (if any). CapGet() reports the current setting. This capability replaces ICAP_FLASHUSED, which is only able to negotiate the flash being on or off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_IMAGEFILTER
member.summary: For devices that support image enhancement filtering. This capability selects the algorithm used to improve the quality of the image.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_NOISEFILTER
member.summary: For devices that support noise filtering. This capability selects the algorithm used to remove noise.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_OVERSCAN
member.summary: Overscan is used to scan outside of the boundaries described by ICAP_FRAMES, and is used to help acquire image data that may be lost because of skewing. This is primarily of use for transport scanners which rely on edge detection to begin scanning. If overscan is supported, then the device is capable of scanning in the inter-document gap to get the skewed image information.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTOMATICBORDERDETECTION
member.summary: Turns automatic border detection on and off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTOMATICDESKEW
member.summary: Turns automatic deskew correction on and off.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTOMATICROTATE
member.summary: When TRUE this capability depends on intelligent features within the Source to automatically rotate the image to the correct position.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_JPEGQUALITY
member.summary: Use this capability as a shortcut to select JPEG quantization tables that tradeoff quality versus compressed image size. Used in concert with DAT_JPEGCOMPRESSION it is possible for an Application to obtain the tables that are appropriate for varying percentages of quality within a given source.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_FEEDERTYPE
member.summary: Allows the Application to set scan parameters depending upon the type of feeder. If the Source has a general type of the feeder only, default scan parameters can depend upon the type of scan (general document or photo). In this case, negotiating this capability will allow the Source adjusting the settings accordingly. It is advised, therefore, that this capabiliry be negotiated prior to the capabilities related to specific Sourve settings (like ICAP_*RESOLUTION, ICAP_PIXELTYPE, etc.) but after the other feeder-related capabilities (CAP_FEEDERENABLED, CAP_FEEDERLOADED).

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_ICCPROFILE
member.summary: Informs the application if the source has an ICC profile and can embed or link it in the current ICAP_IMAGEFILEFORMAT. Tells the source if the application would like an ICC profile embedded or linked into the image file the source will write.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTOSIZE
member.summary: Forces the output image dimensions to match either the current value of ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZES or any of its current allowed values.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTOMATICCROPUSESFRAME
member.summary: Sets True is DAT_IMAGELAYOUT, ICAP_SUPPORTEDSIZE or ICAP_FRAMES reduces the amount of data captured from the device, potentially improving the performance of the driver, even if any automatic detection capability like ICAP_AUTOMATICBORFERDETECTION is set to TRUE.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTOMATICLENGTHDETECTION
member.summary: Controls the automatic detection of the length of a document, this is intended for use with an Automatic Document Feeder.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTOMATICCOLORENABLED
member.summary: The source automatically detects the pixel type of the image and returns either a color image or a non-color image sprcified by ICAP_AUTOMATICCOLORNONCOLORPIXELTYPE.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_AUTOMATICCOLORNONCOLORPIXELTYPE
member.summary: Specifies the non-color pixel type to use when automatic color is enabled.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_COLORMANAGEMENTENABLED
member.summary: Disables the source's color and gamma tables for color and grayscale images, resulting in output that could you be termed "raw".

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_IMAGEMERGE
member.summary: Merges the front and rear image of a document in one of four orientations: from on the top, front on the bottom, from on the left or front on the right.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_IMAGEMERGEHEIGHTTHRESHOLD
member.summary: Specifies a Y-Offset in ICAP_UNITS units. Front and rear images less than or equal to this value are merged according to the settings of ICAP_IMAGEMERGE. If either the front or the rear image is greater than this value, they are not merged.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWCapability.ICAP_SUPPORTEDEXTIMAGEINFO
member.summary: Allows the application to query the data source to see if it supports the operation triplet DG_IMAGE / DAT_EXTMAGEINFO / MSG_GET. Support is only available if the capabiliry is supported and the value TRUE is allowed When set to TRUE, the source supports the DG_IMAGE / DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO / MSG_GET message. and data will be returned by this call for any supported TWEI_ items. When set to FALSE, the application is indicating that it will make no calls to DG_IMAGE / DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO / MSG_GET. FALSE is the default.

member.name: F:Dynamsoft.TWAIN.Enums.TWEIBarcode.TWEI_BARCODECONFIDENCE
member.summary: This number reflects the degree of certainty the bar code engine has in the accuracy of the information obtained from the scanned image and ranges from 0 (no confidence) to 100 (supreme confidence). The Source may return a value of -1 if it does not support confidence reporting. TWBCOR_ROT0 Normal reading orientation TWBCOR_ROT90 Rotated 90 degrees clockwise TWBCOR_ROT180 Rotated 180 degrees clockwise TWBCOR_ROT270 Rotated 270 degrees clockwise TWBCOR_ROTX The orientation is not known.
